guiEmailSender

Class SMTPConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiEmailSender.SMTPConnection

  • public class SMTPConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    Open an SMTP connection to a mailserver and send one mail.
    Version:
    October 2016
    Author:
    Jeremy Novak, Starter code created by Jussi Kangasharju (see README for more details)

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Close the connection. First, terminate on SMTP level, then close the socket.

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Destructor. Closes the connection if something bad happens.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • send

        public void send(Envelope envelope)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Send the message. Write the correct SMTP-commands in the correct order. No checking for errors, just throw them to the caller
        Parameters:
        envelope - the details of the message, as well as it's header details
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if the reply form the server is not the expected reply code

      • sendCommand

        private void sendCommand(java.lang.String command,
                         java.lang.String rc)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Send an SMTP command to the server. Check that the reply code is what is is supposed to be according to RFC 821.
        Parameters:
        command - Command is the information that needs to be sent to the Socket
        rc - A sting that represents the expected Reply Code from the Socket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if the reply form the server is not the expected reply code
